title: Charging - positive rods and 2 conducting spheres

content.prompt: Two identical, electrically neutral conducting spheres, Sphere 1 and Sphere 2, are on insulating stands. Each sphere is connected to ground through a wire held in contact with the sphere by a student, as shown in the figure. A positively charged insulating rod is then brought close to each sphere. With the rods close to the spheres, the wire in contact with Sphere 1 is removed while the other wire remains in contact with Sphere 2. The rods are moved far away from the spheres, after which the wire in contact with Sphere 2 is removed as well. Which of the following correctly describes the final net charge, if any, on the two spheres?

choices.label: Both spheres have a negative net charge.
Sphere 1 has a negative net charge and Sphere 2 is electrically neutral.
Sphere 1 is electrically neutral and Sphere 2 has a negative net charge.
